transportAdvice: Orlando is a car-centric city where walking between attractions is generally impractical due to distances; a light rail system connects the airport to the downtown area, and local bus services exist but have limited coverage of major theme park corridors. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available, and most visitors rely on personal vehicles or resort shuttle services to get around.

weather.description: Mild and pleasant winter weather with cool nights and comfortable daytime temperatures, making it one of the more agreeable months to visit.
Similar to January, with slightly warmer days and low rainfall, ideal for outdoor theme park visits.
Warm spring conditions begin to set in with longer sunny days and minimal rain, though crowds increase around spring break.
Warm and mostly dry with comfortable humidity levels, one of the best months for outdoor activities.
Heat and humidity begin to build noticeably, with afternoon showers becoming more frequent as summer approaches.
Hot and very humid with daily afternoon thunderstorms typical of Florida's wet season; mornings are usually clearer.
The hottest and wettest month of the year, with intense heat, high humidity, and near-daily thunderstorms in the afternoon.
Conditions remain very similar to July with persistent heat, humidity, and frequent afternoon storms.
Still hot and stormy with the wet season continuing; September also falls within hurricane season, though direct impacts are rare.
Temperatures begin to ease and rainfall decreases, making October a popular and more comfortable time to visit.
Pleasantly mild with low humidity and minimal rain, offering good conditions for theme parks and outdoor exploration.
Cool and dry winter weather returns, with festive holiday decorations across the major attractions adding seasonal appeal.
